{"step_by_step_thinking": "Posterior pituitary insufficiency refers to the inadequate production or release of hormones from the posterior pituitary gland. Diabetes mellitus, on the other hand, is caused by a deficiency or ineffective action of insulin, which is produced by the pancreas and not the posterior pituitary gland.
